abstract: Commerce Dept report shows that businesses are trimming investment plans to respond to softening United States economy, despite fact that purchases of durable good rebounded 4 percent in March.
lead_paragraph: Excluding rising demand for commercial aircraft, orders for long-lasting manufactured goods fell for a sixth straight month.

headline.main: Orders of Durable Goods Rise, but Report Shows Drop in Investment
headline.print_headline: Business Briefing; Sign of Weakness in Durable Goods Report

snippet: Excluding rising demand for commercial aircraft, orders for long-lasting manufactured goods fell for a sixth straight month.
